security_audit.summary: Official Anthropic skill with minimal audit per policy. Contains documentation and a local validation script. No suspicious patterns observed.

content.user_title: Build reliable Claude Code agents fast
content.value_statement: You need clear rules and examples for agent files and triggering behavior. This skill provides templates, patterns, and validation steps for consistent agents.
actual_capabilities: Explains required frontmatter fields and validation rules for agent files
Provides system prompt design patterns for analysis, generation, validation, and orchestration
Shows triggering example formats with commentary guidance
Offers an AI assisted agent creation prompt and JSON schema
Includes a shell script to validate agent file structure and content
limitations: Does not generate agent files automatically
Does not run agents or verify runtime behavior
Does not integrate with external repositories or APIs
Does not handle plugin deployment steps

use_cases.title: Draft a new agent file
use_cases.description: Create a complete agent file with correct frontmatter, triggering examples, and a structured system prompt.

use_cases.title: Align team conventions
use_cases.description: Standardize agent structure, tool access, and validation rules across multiple plugin agents.

use_cases.title: Write clear triggering examples
use_cases.description: Develop consistent example blocks that explain when and why an agent should trigger.

prompt_templates.title: Minimal agent template
prompt_templates.scenario: You need a basic agent file
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a minimal agent markdown template with required frontmatter fields and a short system prompt outline.

prompt_templates.title: Triggering examples
prompt_templates.prompt: Write three <example> blocks for a code review agent with context, user message, assistant response, and commentary.

prompt_templates.title: System prompt design
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a system prompt for a test generation agent with responsibilities, process steps, quality standards, and output format.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced agent JSON
prompt_templates.prompt: Return the JSON schema with identifier, whenToUse, and systemPrompt fields, and include one short example value for each.

output_examples.input: Summarize the required frontmatter fields for a Claude Code agent.
output: Name is required and must use lowercase with hyphens
Description must include triggering conditions and examples
Model must be inherit, sonnet, opus, or haiku
Color must be one of the supported UI colors
Tools are optional and should follow least privilege

best_practices: Include two to four triggering examples with clear commentary
Write system prompts in second person with defined output format
Validate agent files with the script before testing triggers
anti_patterns: Granting unnecessary tool access by default
Omitting process steps or output format in system prompts

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. The guidance targets Claude Code agents and is usable with Claude and Codex workflows.

faq.question: What are the limits of the validation script?
faq.answer: It checks file structure and fields only. It does not test runtime behavior or triggering.

faq.question: How do I integrate this with my plugin?
faq.answer: Create agent files in your plugin agents directory and validate them with the script.

faq.question: Does this skill manage data safety?
faq.answer: No. It provides best practices, but you must enforce your own data handling policies.

faq.question: What if my agent does not trigger?
faq.answer: Add more examples, refine commentary, and match real user phrasing in the description.

faq.question: How does this compare to generic prompt guides?
faq.answer: It is specific to Claude Code agent files, frontmatter rules, and triggering examples.
